data.title: Syntax highlighting taking 30+ seconds
data.body:
Atom hangs seemingly on application of syntax color scheme

To reproduce:

- Download and open http://code.jquery.com/jquery-1.11.3.min.js

Timeline:
![screen shot 2015-08-12 at 11 59 37 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1584732/9229142/ad516828-40e9-11e5-9105-3088213391f7.png)

data.title: 'Find in Project' returns no results
data.body:
'Find in Project' returns no results when opened for the first time. Once, opened results appear.
To show results, toggle 'Use RegExp' or any of the other toggles.

data.title: Cannot scroll/move cursor to the end of the line when using the "Base16 Tomorrow Dark" syntax theme.
data.body:
### Description:

With soft-wrap disabled and a long line of text that exceeds the available viewport width of the editor pane, erroneous behaviour is observed when attempting to go to the end of the line either via the (bottom) scroll bar or through the doesn't work properly and requires a repeat invocation to work as expected.
### Steps to reproduce:

You can reproduce this either using the scroll bar or using a keyboard command (e.g. `editor:move-to-end-of-screen-line` with whatever key shortcut applies on your platform/configuration).
1. Open Atom with an empty file. Make sure soft wrap is disabled.
2. type a long string on a single line --- your string should exceed the width of the editor viewport.
3. Press <kbd>End</kbd> or try to scroll (using the scrollbar at the bottom of the editor pane) as far right as you can.
### Actual results:

In the case of the end-of-line keyboard shortcut, the cursor does move to the end of the line, but both cursor and end of line content is not visible.

In the case of the scrollbar, you cannot go past a point which is just before the end of the line. The cursor remains hidden, as does the end of the line.
### Expected results:

In the case of the scrollbar event, you should be able to actually read the content at the end of the line, with some appropriate padding.

In the case of the keyboard commands, you should see both end of line content and the cursor blinking there.
### Notes:
- Repeating the `editor:move-to-end-of-screen-line` command one more time does move to the end of the line. I couldn't find a way to achieve this using the scroll bar.
- This issue was consistently reproducible on OS X.

data.title: Idea: make restoring from cache easier
data.body:
I have to start by saying that `~/.atom/storage` just saved my ass after I overwrote an untracked file in a project, and I'm very grateful for that! Would it be a worthwhile idea to implement a restore feature for people who do dumb things like me?

Proposal:

``` bash
# Lists projects saved, and last save timestamp
atom-restore --list-all
# Lists files in a project, and last save timestamp for each file
atom-restore list {project_name}
# Restores the project files in the current folder
atom-restore {project_name} [-o dest_dir]
```

data.title: URGENT: loosing data due to file versions
data.body:
This is the 10th time I lost data due to the Atom editor. 
I work with 2 panels open and a lot of file. Each time I restart my activities and re-open the editor, the files are open but most times they are previous version of what I was doing. 

For example now I just lost 12 hours of coding due to Atom!!!!!

It is loading a previous version of the file, which doesn't make any sense because I do not have versions or git. It's on my computer, that's it

Configuration: Ubuntu 15. Atom latest.

data.title: Add Support for Opening .plist Files
data.body: I was working on some object persistence using NSCoder in Swift which produces a .plist file. I can view it using Xcode or quick look on my mac. When I tried opening it in Atom (version 1.05) it recognized it as a "Property List (Old-Style) file, but displayed [this](http://imgur.com/yuDmV7g). It would be nice if Atom supported this for iOS developers.

data.title: Find in Project caches prior search results
data.body:
For example: ![screenshot 2015-08-11 18 50 00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3803466/9215014/deff6ba8-4059-11e5-9bd1-3dfef03dac26.png)

The search for "rsvpOptions" doesn't search what is intended. It immediately comes up with results of prior search, on "mainGuest". I can force an actual search by changing say, the case sensitivity setting in the Find in Project panel.

I noticed this only today, after updating Atom to 1.0.6. Can't say if this is bug in Atom or some misbehaving package I'm using. (Is there a way on cli to launch Atom with non-core packages temporarily disabled to test?)

data.title: .gitignore removes files & dirs from tree
data.body:
Hi. Early tree styles `.gitignore`'s files & dirs as disabled, but now it removes from entire tree.

I have this `.gitignore:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/775692/9210788/ef5939a2-4086-11e5-948b-49c6bfab22c5.png)

Then I added `node_modules` and restarted atom.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/775692/9210818/0bb0d880-4087-11e5-9b34-08091387b6dd.png)

And `node_modules` has gone.

```
➜  atom --version
1.0.5

tree-view
0.182.0
```

Not sure atom's or tree-view's bug so I post here.

data.title: Open »Project Find Results« in same split pane
data.body:
1. Split the editor in two panes, one left one right for example, and focus a document on the right
2. Use Ctrl-Shift-F to find stuff across the project
3. In the results dialog (which will pop up on the right where the focused document was) click on a result

Expected: The file opens up as a tab to the right next of the Project Find Results tab. Instead it opens in the left pane, somewhere completely different.

data.title: Accidental multiple tab closing --> follow Chrome and Firefox
data.body: When having many tabs open, one keep accidentally closing some of them because the Xs appear all the time. Atom should mimic what Firefox and Chrome do with many tabs open.

data.title: Atom on Windows Goes to Black Screen on Display Switch
data.body: Atom 1.0.5 has developed a bad habit, of when I remove my laptop from my docking station, going to a frame containing only a black screen.  In order to restore operation Atom must be closed and restarted.  I have had this issue with Google Chrome for some time, however Atom had been immune until now.

data.title: allow a custom atom direcotry without using the ATOM_HOME environment variable
data.body: It should be possible to define a custom home direcory that is not _~/Atom_ without setting the `ATOM_HOME` environment variable on the target machine. That way I could carry over my whole editor with all its settings across machines.

data.title: npm integration
data.body:
It would be nice to have some npm integration, like [what Visual Studio has now](http://webtooling.visualstudio.com/package-managers/npm/). This is what Visual Studio does:
- Autocompletion of everything in package.json, including npm package names and version numbers.
- Automatically runs "npm install" on save of package.json
- Shows tooltip with info about package when hovering over it in package.json
- Shows installed packages and their dependencies as a tree structure in the IDE

I'm not sure if this is the right place for feature requests, sorry if I'm posting in the wrong area.

data.title: Atom loses unsaved changes and doesn't remember my open tabs
data.body:
I have just downloaded **atom-windows.zip** (version 1.0.5) unzipped it and started atom.exe on my Windows 7 machine. 

When I close the editor I get a messagebox saying

> 'test.txt' has changes, do you want to save them?
> Your changes will be lost if you close this item without saving.

For new tabs that have not beens saved to a file yet I get _'untitled'_ instead of the filename in that messagebox.

Atom should close without this messagebox and when I reopen atom, it should be right where I left of. The same tabs should be open and **all unsaved changes should still be there**.

data.title: Soft-wrapped lines are wrapped in a <span> with the classes of the last element of the previous line
data.body:
While working on a theme, I noticed the following glitch: the color of the variable GRID on line 156 is different from the one on line 157.

When a line is soft-wrapped, the soft-wrapped next line is wrapped with the classes of the last element of the previous line. In the example below, the last character on line 157 is a comma with the classes `meta delimiter object comma coffee`, and the entire rest of the wrapped line is wrapped inside a div with those classes. Notice how the code of the wrapped part of the line is indented one level more.

Top and bottom of the image are the same, I've just highlighted the important areas.

![atom-soft-wrap-error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3703530/9200693/5281dc84-4049-11e5-92d7-e843ade01837.jpg)

While searching for duplicates, I thought #4842 could be similar.

Atom 1.0.5 on Mac OS X
Theme: minimal-syntax

data.title: In handlebars files Atom doesn't color text properly when there is a forward slash in the name
data.body:
To reproduce:

Create a new test.hbs file with the following two lines:

```
{{forms-colors-nicely name="priceManualSwitch" checked=manualPriceChecked}}
{{forms/colors-nicely name="priceManualSwitch" checked=manualPriceChecked}}
```

The second line remains all grey (apart from the {{ and }}) whereas 'name' and 'checked' change to orange on line 1 and "priceManualSwitch" to green.

![handlebars-grey](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12710362/9199993/819b6e74-403d-11e5-98ba-a2050192ca52.png)

It appears that the / in the component name stops the nice coloring. The / is used in Ember in particular from about version 1.10 to 1.13 to organise components into sub folders.

Version 1.0.5, Windows 7 64bit

data.title: Atom package and install views in settings not showing all installed packages
data.body: I was trying to see if linter-pylint was installed on my atom. If I navigate to the packages directory, I can see it. If I run `apm list`, I can see it, but in atom if I search for "linter" in the packages view of the settings panel then nothing shows up, not even the `linter` package, despite them being very obviously installed.

data.title: git support broken for one of my projects
data.body:
- It has a `.git` folder in the root.
- The project has several submodules.
- The `.git` folder is not grayed out as usual.
- No visual indication from atom at all that atom understands the git status.
- Using `git status` in the project via terminal works fine.
- I am using atom 1.0.5.

data.title: Clear pending frames on folding specs
data.body:
Fixes #8301.

It seems like, for a time related problem, we're getting intermittent build failures on Travis [for this line](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/spec/text-editor-component-spec.coffee#L827) (which was added as part of #8009).

This PR simply bypasses the `nextAnimationFrame` call when there is no pending frame (as we did for https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/spec/text-editor-component-spec.coffee#L852).

/cc: @atom/feedback @thomasjo

data.title: Page Up and Page Down don't move correctly with the window.
data.body:
Each page up and page down move the contents of the screen up a full amount but it's offf by one line. For each page down, the cursor also moves down a line relative to the window.

If you open [this file](https://github.com/smparkes/sphinxsearch/blob/upstream-trunk/src/sphinx.cpp) and start at line 1, then hold page down you will see that cursor on the screen creeps down the window until it's off the bottom of the screen instead of holding its position. By line 7968, the cursor is off the screen.

Atom 1.0.0
Fedora 22
Gnome Shell 3.16.3

data.title: Copy project path (keyboard shortcut + command)
data.body:
The tree view has _Copy full path_ and _Copy project path_. In the edit-menu there is _Copy path_ (which copies the full path). The latter can also be used via a keyboard shortcut and the command palette [cmd+shift+p].

It would be great if the edit-menu (as well as the command palette) would could be split into a _Copy full path_ and _Copy project path_ — I find them very useful, but currently they are only available using the mouse. :mouse:

data.title: Crash when I create a file named "todo"
data.body: Atom 1.0.5 crashes when I want to create a file from the tree on the left, if I give the name "todo".
